channel.title: Gilded Altar and Lectern
channel.description:
i recently spent 11M on getting 70 construction and building a full chapel with gilded altar and 2 burners and a full study with teleport lectern. anyone who wishes to use the altar and study are more then welcome, you will have to provide the marentills though for the burners as i will open my house and go about my daily business.
if you wish to use the altar PM me ingame (maminerr) and let me know if you wish to use it. i also have combat ring and boxing ring, fally, varrock and lummy teles, a mounted amulet of glory and teak shelves 2 (when tea is made off these shelves you get an added +3 con levels) and will be adding a dungeon very soon. youre all very welcome to use it whenever :))
Chapel [IMG]http://www.runescapetop.com/up/images/6bd15.png[/img]
Study&Combat ring [IMG]http://www.runescapetop.com/up/images/6be62.png[/img]

item.title: Gilded Altar and Lectern
item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:328915”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=425308.msg3124012#msg3124012 date=1265843422]
Nobody answered my question above – can you go in someone’s house now when they aren’t inside it? Do they just have to be online or something?
[/quote]
People can enter your house as long as your inside, and if you leave, the people can stay but not enter again.

I don’t know if people are kicked when you log off or not…[/quote]
they are kicked.

[quote=“Rich, post:16, topic:328915”]Just a suggestion, but you should build a quest hall next to the chapel, I find the glory to be the easiest and fastest way to bank. Besides that, it looks pretty good.

Nobody answered my question above – can you go in someone’s house now when they aren’t inside it? Do they just have to be online or something?

Nope, according to the knowledge base:

[quote=http://www.runescape.com/kbase/guid/construction_the_basics]Go to a friend’s house

Upon clicking this, you are prompted to enter your friend’s username. If they are in their house, not in building mode and have allowed visitors to enter (explained later), you will be allowed to go to their house.[/quote][/quote]
glory is set up 2 rooms over from those main rooms

Read full topic

item.title: Gilded Altar and Lectern
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Lothy:

Nobody answered my question above – can you go in someone’s house now when they aren’t inside it? Do they just have to be online or something?

People can enter your house as long as your inside, and if you leave, the people can stay but not enter again.

I don’t know if people are kicked when you log off or not…

Read full topic

item.title: Gilded Altar and Lectern
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Just a suggestion, but you should build a quest hall next to the chapel, I find the glory to be the easiest and fastest way to bank. Besides that, it looks pretty good.

Lothy:

Nobody answered my question above – can you go in someone’s house now when they aren’t inside it? Do they just have to be online or something?

Nope, according to the knowledge base:

Go to a friend's house

Upon clicking this, you are prompted to enter your friend’s username. If they are in their house, not in building mode and have allowed visitors to enter (explained later), you will be allowed to go to their house.

Read full topic

item.title: Gilded Altar and Lectern
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Nobody answered my question above – can you go in someone’s house now when they aren’t inside it? Do they just have to be online or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Gilded Altar and Lectern
item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

I think I did oak drawers that give 180xp and cost 3 oak planks till 69 con. Cost me 7m, including gilded altar, dungeon and leveling. But that was long ago so oak prices might have changed…

oak planks are 500gpea
marble blocks are 325kea
gold leafs are 130kea

my house is set up like so:


the study is close to the teleport portal to enable fast tab making.


the altar is also close to the teleport portal for fast prayer


the teleport room is close to both altar and study room allowing you to teleport quickly to Varrock, Falador and Lumbridge

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I have 52 con :S

Working on it, but doing WC first.

Read full topic

item.title: Gilded Altar and Lectern
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“maminerr, post:9, topic:328915”][quote author=Newty link=topic=425308.msg3123538#msg3123538 date=1265805636]

You don’t need 75 for the gilded altar, you can get it with 68-70 iirc, crystal saw and the tea give construction bonuses.

70 construction for 11mil seems kinda expensive, I remember getting 80 with basically all the same stuff for 15-20m.

The prices have, generally, been going north for quite a while now for many items.
I’d like to max prayer on my noob, but it’s going to be expensive.

11 to 43 prayer with 180 Dragon bones using a gilded alter
[/quote]

i can provide your altar and teleportational needs[/quote]

Sounds good, I’ll hit you up in a couple of weeks because I need to get to 53 or 54 prayer on my pure. Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Gilded Altar and Lectern
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

How close are the altar & study to the portal you enter the house in? If it was me I’d want them as close as possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Gilded Altar and Lectern
item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

[quote=“Rich, post:5, topic:328915”]You don’t need 75 for the gilded altar, you can get it with 68-70 iirc, crystal saw and the tea give construction bonuses.

70 construction for 11mil seems kinda expensive, I remember getting 80 with basically all the same stuff for 15-20m.[/quote]
the crystal saw adds +3 and the tea adds +3 which means you could get it at 69 really.
i chose 70 as i can now get a dungeon aswell.
it cost me 11M making carved oak tables and for the chapel and study (these rooms were very expensive, the altar was 3M alone)

@Lothy: when you do decide to do this, get the tea in my house it will cost you alot less, i spent near on 1M on my teak shelves for the kettle cup and teapot

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

Newty:

About time

haha you actually inspired me to do it
lectern will make you all good money though, and altar will save you all on prayer levels :)))
ill end up getting mine up for new prayers with it also.
